edu.harvard

Class CS50

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.harvard.CS50

  • public class CS50
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static char getChar()
      Reads a line of text from standard input and returns the equivalent char; if text does not represent a char, user is prompted to retry.
      static double getDouble()
      Reads a line of text from standard input and returns the equivalent double as precisely as possible; if text does not represent a double, user is prompted to retry.
      static float getFloat()
      Reads a line of text from standard input and returns the equivalent float as precisely as possible; if text does not represent a float, user is prompted to retry.
      static int getInt()
      Reads a line of text from standard input and returns it as an int in [-231, 231 - 1) if possible; if text does not represent such an int, user is prompted to retry.
      static long getLong()
      Reads a line of text from standard input and returns an equivalent long in [-263, 263 - 1) if possible; if text does not represent such a long, user is prompted to retry.
      static java.lang.String getString()
      Reads a line of text from standard input and returns it as a String, sans trailing newline character.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getChar

        public static char getChar()
        Reads a line of text from standard input and returns the equivalent char; if text does not represent a char, user is prompted to retry. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored. If line can't be read, returns Character.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        char

      • getDouble

        public static double getDouble()
        Reads a line of text from standard input and returns the equivalent double as precisely as possible; if text does not represent a double, user is prompted to retry. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored. If line can't be read, returns Double.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        double

      • getFloat

        public static float getFloat()
        Reads a line of text from standard input and returns the equivalent float as precisely as possible; if text does not represent a float, user is prompted to retry. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored. If line can't be read, returns Float.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        float

      • getInt

        public static int getInt()
        Reads a line of text from standard input and returns it as an int in [-231, 231 - 1) if possible; if text does not represent such an int, user is prompted to retry. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored. If line can't be read, returns Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        int

      • getLong

        public static long getLong()
        Reads a line of text from standard input and returns an equivalent long in [-263, 263 - 1) if possible; if text does not represent such a long, user is prompted to retry. Leading and trailing whitespace is ignored. If line can't be read, returns Long.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        long

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString()
        Reads a line of text from standard input and returns it as a String, sans trailing newline character. (Ergo, if user inputs only "\n", returns "" not null.) Returns null upon error or no input whatsoever (i.e., just EOF). Leading and trailing whitespace is not ignored.
        Returns:
        String
